reviews.review_msg: Caring and passionate. Tutorial readings and discussion are very engaging.

Ad: He analyzed historical political events from a more individual perspective. He is very flexible during the class and he is free to answer all questions.
Something which can be improved; the class format can be improved
Not many slides, but explains in detail and encourage students to ask questions during the lectures. Sometimes speaks fast, but he is a very flexible prof.

Sukhjit was a good Prof, his lectures just really sucked. Course was graded by 3 Primary sources (2 written, 1 presentation), a pop quiz, and a final exam. Be prepared to type fast, he speaks very quick, and his slide shows do not convey a lot of information. He does take the time to answer questions which is good. Not very clear on grading.
Always respectful to students and open minded. Nice guy. Nice job.

Pros: Knowledgeable, open-minded, calm, and a very good facilitator of discussion. Cons: A little on the quieter side, sometimes it is hard to follow what he is saying, and his lecturing style can become boring quickly. In general, however, I found professor Chohan to be a solid instructor.
